title: Love Island's Danny Williams insists he was faithful to Jourdan Riane
text:
Danny said he is devastated (Picture: Rex Features)

Danny Williams has insisted he was ‘100% faithful’ to Jourdan Riane – despite her slamming him for ‘dishonesty and disloyalty’.

The Love Island couple have split up after three months together and just weeks after they moved in together.

It was claimed that Jourdan, 24, ended things after discovering the 21-year-old model was flirting with other women.

However, Danny has denied being unfaithful while saying that he is ‘devastated’ about the break-up.

Danny and Jourdan have split (Picture: Instagram)

Accompanying a moody picture of himself, the islander wrote on Instagram: ‘In light of what’s been said about Jourdan and myself in the media at the moment, I would like to express that I am honestly devastated that this relationship has come to an end and it is a huge shame that we couldn’t make things work.

‘I would also like to make it crystal clear that I was 100% faithful to Jourdan, and this is genuinely not the reason why we have broken up, despite what has already been said. This is something that we felt was the right decision for the both of us.’

Advertisement

Danny continued: ‘I would like to say thank you to everyone who has been understanding of the situation, and who has personally supported us both through this difficult time.

‘My time spent with Jourdan was honestly one of my most happiest, and I would like to wish her the best moving forward.’

However, Jourdan’s statement on the split was a lot less positive.

The influencer – also accompanying a moody picture of herself – wrote: ‘I have to respect me first.

‘I genuinely had such a great time in my relationship and I don’t regret the decisions I’ve made as far as choosing to give someone a chance however, I have boundaries. In a relationship there are things I won’t tolerate. Lack of respect, disloyalty & dishonesty are amongst those things.

‘I know people will come with the “I told you so”, “you should’ve listened” (maybe it’s true) & more than likely snigger/laugh at my situation. The reality is my mum raised me to be a strong woman and always give the benefit of the doubt and let people prove themselves to you. Which is what I did.

I went into this with a genuine heart & real intention to make it work. The love was as real as the hurt is now. But…. I will continue to grow and love myself first. If it doesn’t feel right, it’s not right.’

Jourdan ended things (Picture: Splash News)

Advertisement

Advertisement

This shock split comes just weeks after the couple confirmed they had moved in together.

While it was assumed that Jourdan had moved into her own house alone, Danny, 21, was seen holding the keys to the same gaff and wrote on Instagram: ‘Feeling grateful to be able to make this possible. Hard work pays off🥂Excited for the next chapter.’

The pair were only a couple for a few days in the villa, following Danny’s romances with Yewande Biala and Arabella Chi, but just a week after they were dumped from the island, the islanders had made it official.

Now just two couples from the class of 2019 remain – Molly Mae Hague and Tommy Fury, and Curtis Pritchard and Maura Higgins. Let’s hope the winter edition has better luck.
